story_19_03000/2401_1001_0200_10:
This is NOT happening! Unbelievable! It’s pure 
nonsense! How could I lose?!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_0300_10:
Not once...but twice! That pest in the red hat
was one thing, but to be beaten by...by a bunch
of amateurs...
story_19_03000/2401_1001_0400_10:
My commands were more precise, my Pokémon
was stronger... I had the upper hand in practically
every way! How...how did this happen?!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_0500_10: How in the world did I loooooose?!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_0800_10:
Lear... You’re extremely powerful—there’s no
doubt about that. Your skills as a Trainer might
even surpass [Name:PlayerNickname ]’s.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_0900_10: But [EN:Gen Ref="255" M="he" F="she" ] has a few things that you don’t.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1000_10:
[EN:Gen Ref="255" M="He" F="She" ] has the capacity to have FUN in a Pokémon 
battle...and real friendship...and, most importantly,
a real bond with [EN:Gen Ref="255" M="his" F="her" ] Pokémon.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1100_10:
How...how can stupid things like that make a
difference to who wins and who loses?
It doesn’t make sense!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1300_10: Lear, you can’t use sync moves, can you?
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1500_10:
What? Wait, now that you mention it... I didn’t see
him use any sync moves in either battle!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1600_10:
Sync stones are what turn the bond between
Trainers and Pokémon into power.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1700_10: If Lear can’t use sync moves, then that means—
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1800_10:
Stone, shmone! Master Lear’s been crushin’ it
battle after battle for a long time without having
to use one.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_1900_10:
Exactly! The young master’s worked harder than
anyone else to get to where he is now and to
become the ultimate victor.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_2000_10:
He can win without using sync moves—and
without help from anyone else!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_2100_10: And you two are OK with that?
story_19_03000/2401_1001_2300_10:
Lear doesn’t depend on anyone but himself.
He fights for himself and nobody else, and you
two just watch from the sidelines.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_2400_10: Don’t you think that’s a little...sad?
story_19_03000/2401_1001_2700_10:
Lear, you have friends who care about you.
Friends who have stuck with you all this time.
story_19_03000/2401_1001_2800_10: All you have to do is reach out a hand—
story_19_03000/2401_1001_3000_10:
None of that is of any use to me!
With my skill and unrivaled discipline when it
comes to training, there’s nothing I can’t do!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_3100_10:
That goes for the PML, too! I and I alone will crush
every last incompetent weakling in the running!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_3200_10:
That’s why I founded this entire tournament in the
first place—to prove that the power of one man
is stronger than any stupid bond!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_3600_10:
Maybe we should just give him some space
for now...
story_19_03000/2401_1001_3800_10:
Hm? What’s wrong, [Name:PlayerNickname ]?
Aren’t you coming?
story_19_03000/2401_0301_3900_10: See you in the tournament, Lear!
story_19_03000/2401_0302_4100_10: Our next battle will be at the PML!
story_19_03000/2401_1001_4400_10: You really have grown a lot, haven’t you?
story_19_03000/2401_1001_4500_10:
Let’s fight as hard as we can in the finals, team!
I want another chance at battling against Lear!
